verses.text: Now it came to pass in the third year of Hoshea son of Elah king of Israel , \add that\add* Hezekiah the son of Ahaz king of Judah began to reign.\f + \fr 18.1 \ft Hezekiah: he is called Ezekias\f*

Twenty and five years old was he when he began to reign ; and he reigned twenty and nine years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name also \add was\add* Abi , the daughter of Zachariah.\f + \fr 18.2 \ft Abi: also called, Abijah\f*
And he did \add that which was\add* right in the sight of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, according to all that David his father did. \p

¶ He removed the high places , and brake the images , and cut down the groves , and brake in pieces the brasen serpent that Moses had made : for unto those days the children of Israel did burn incense to it: and he called it Nehushtan.\f + \fr 18.4 \ft images: Heb. statues\f*\f + \fr 18.4 \ft Nehushtan: that is, A piece of brass\f*
He trusted in the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God of Israel ; so that after him was none like him among all the kings of Judah , nor \add any\add* that were before him.

For he clave to the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, \add and\add* departed not from following him, but kept his commandments , which the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* commanded Moses.  +  r 18.6  t from…: Heb. from after him *
And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* was with him; \add and\add* he prospered whithersoever he went forth : and he rebelled against the king of Assyria , and served him not.
He smote the Philistines , \add even\add* unto Gaza , and the borders thereof, from the tower of the watchmen to the fenced city.\f + \fr 18.8 \ft Gaza: Heb. Azzah\f* \p

¶ And it came to pass in the fourth year of king Hezekiah , which \add was\add* the seventh year of Hoshea son of Elah king of Israel , \add that\add* Shalmaneser king of Assyria came up against Samaria , and besieged it.
And at the end of three years they took it: \add even\add* in the sixth year of Hezekiah , that \add is\add* the ninth year of Hoshea king of Israel , Samaria was taken.
And the king of Assyria did carry away Israel unto Assyria , and put them in Halah and in Habor \add by\add* the river of Gozan , and in the cities of the Medes :

Because they obeyed not the voice of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* their God , but transgressed his covenant , \add and\add* all that Moses the servant of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* commanded , and would not hear \add them\add*, nor do \add them\add*. \p
¶ Now in the fourteenth year of king Hezekiah did Sennacherib king of Assyria come up against all the fenced cities of Judah , and took them.\f + \fr 18.13 \ft Sennacherib: Heb. Sanherib\f*

And Hezekiah king of Judah sent to the king of Assyria to Lachish , saying , I have offended ; return from me: that which thou puttest on me will I bear. And the king of Assyria appointed unto Hezekiah king of Judah three hundred talents of silver and thirty talents of gold.
And Hezekiah gave \add him\add* all the silver that was found in the house of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and in the treasures of the king’s house.

At that time did Hezekiah cut off \add the gold from\add* the doors of the temple of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and \add from\add* the pillars which Hezekiah king of Judah had overlaid , and gave it to the king of Assyria.\f + \fr 18.16 \ft it: Heb. them\f* \p

¶ And the king of Assyria sent Tartan and Rabsaris and Rab-shakeh from Lachish to king Hezekiah with a great host against Jerusalem. And they went up and came to Jerusalem. And when they were come up , they came and stood by the conduit of the upper pool , which \add is\add* in the highway of the fuller’s field.\f + \fr 18.17 \ft great: Heb. heavy\f*

And when they had called to the king , there came out to them Eliakim the son of Hilkiah , which \add was\add* over the household , and Shebna the scribe , and Joah the son of Asaph the recorder.\f + \fr 18.18 \ft scribe: or, secretary\f*
And Rab-shakeh said unto them, Speak ye now to Hezekiah , Thus saith the great king , the king of Assyria , What confidence \add is\add* this wherein thou trustest ?

Thou sayest , (but \add they are but\add* vain words ,) \add I have\add* counsel and strength for the war. Now on whom dost thou trust , that thou rebellest against me?\f + \fr 18.20 \ft sayest: or, talkest\f*\f + \fr 18.20 \ft vain…: Heb. word of the lips\f*\f + \fr 18.20 \ft I have…: or, but counsel and strength are for the war\f*

Now, behold, thou trustest upon the staff of this bruised reed , \add even\add* upon Egypt , on which if a man lean , it will go into his hand , and pierce it: so \add is\add* Pharaoh king of Egypt unto all that trust on him.\f + \fr 18.21 \ft trustest: Heb. trustest thee\f*

But if ye say unto me, We trust in the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* our God : \add is\add* not that he, whose high places and whose altars Hezekiah hath taken away , and hath said to Judah and Jerusalem , Ye shall worship before this altar in Jerusalem ?

Now therefore, I pray thee, give pledges to my lord the king of Assyria , and I will deliver thee two thousand horses , if thou be able on thy part to set riders upon them.\f + \fr 18.23 \ft pledges: or, hostages\f*
How then wilt thou turn away the face of one captain of the least of my master’s servants , and put thy trust on Egypt for chariots and for horsemen ?

Am I now come up without the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* against this place to destroy it? The 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* said to me, Go up against this land , and destroy it.

Then said Eliakim the son of Hilkiah , and Shebna , and Joah , unto Rab-shakeh , Speak , I pray thee, to thy servants in the Syrian language ; for we understand \add it:\add* and talk not with us in the Jews’ language in the ears of the people that \add are\add* on the wall.

But Rab-shakeh said unto them, Hath my master sent me to thy master , and to thee, to speak these words ? \add hath he\add* not \add sent me\add* to the men which sit on the wall , that they may eat their own dung , and drink their own piss with you?\f + \fr 18.27 \ft their own piss: Heb. the water of their feet\f*
Then Rab-shakeh stood and cried with a loud voice in the Jews’ language , and spake , saying , Hear the word of the great king , the king of Assyria :
Thus saith the king , Let not Hezekiah deceive you: for he shall not be able to deliver you out of his hand :

Neither let Hezekiah make you trust in the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, saying , The 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* will surely deliver us, and this city shall not be delivered into the hand of the king of Assyria.

Hearken not to Hezekiah : for thus saith the king of Assyria , Make \add an agreement\add* with me by a present , and come out to me, and \add then\add* eat ye every man of his own vine , and every one of his fig tree , and drink ye every one the waters of his cistern :\f + \fr 18.31 \ft Make…: or, Seek my favour: Heb. Make with me a blessing\f*\f + \fr 18.31 \ft cistern: or, pit\f*

Until I come and take you away to a land like your own land , a land of corn and wine , a land of bread and vineyards , a land of oil olive and of honey , that ye may live , and not die : and hearken not unto Hezekiah , when he persuadeth you, saying , The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* will deliver us.\f + \fr 18.32 \ft persuadeth: or, deceiveth\f*
Hath any of the gods of the nations delivered at all his land out of the hand of the king of Assyria ?
Where \add are\add* the gods of Hamath , and of Arpad ? where \add are\add* the gods of Sepharvaim , Hena , and Ivah ? have they delivered Samaria out of mine hand ?

Who \add are\add* they among all the gods of the countries , that have delivered their country out of mine hand , that the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* should deliver Jerusalem out of mine hand ?
But the people held their peace , and answered him not a word : for the king’s commandment was, saying , Answer him not.

Then came Eliakim the son of Hilkiah , which \add was\add* over the household , and Shebna the scribe , and Joah the son of Asaph the recorder , to Hezekiah with \add their\add* clothes rent , and told him the words of Rab-shakeh.
